page.title: 19Water-Skiing, Lound
page.content: Lound Water Ski Club has two lakes. They were made from an old gravel quarry especially for top-class water skiing. One lake is round and is used for leisure skiing and the other lake is long and is used for competitions. The water in both lakes varies from six to twelve feet deep. The club has over a hundred members, some travelling a hundred miles. Some of the British Water Ski team are members of the club. People bring caravans and stay overnight on the site. They have discos and barbecues in the summer. There are three kinds of skiing - slalom, ski jumping and trick skiing. You can start skiing when you are three years old. You start on two wooden skiis and then, when you improve, you use one ski. As well as skis you need a wet suit, a ski vest, a ski rope and a crash helmet.
